DataElement.preferredDefinition: A sponsor-defined identifier which can be used for pre-printed or auto-generated numbers on the CRF.

ReferenceDocuments.name: What is the protocol deviatio
ReferenceDocuments.description: What is the protocol deviation identifier?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Case Report Form  Completion Instructions
ReferenceDocuments.description: If collected on the CRF, sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each record has a unique identifier.

ReferenceDocuments.name: DVSPID
ReferenceDocuments.description: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDASH Implementation Notes
ReferenceDocuments.description: Since SPID is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. Typically used as an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question or to reconcile data. May be used to record pre-printed number (e.g. line number, record number) on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.
